abstracts.cdata!:
The Guyana Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit (PRSC) Project was satisfactory in outcome, likely to
            be sustainable, with a modest institutional development
            impact, and Bank and Borrower performances that were
            satisfactory. The following lessons were gleaned from the
            project and used to adapt the content of the follow-on
            Poverty Reduction and Public Management Operation: 1)
            carefully setting the project's timeframe while
            considering capacity constraints; 2) donor's
            coordinating technical assistance; and 3) focusing on fewer
            areas. Also based on these lessons, the Government and the
            International Development Association agree that a series a
            series of (programmatic) development policy operations,
            timed to match the speed of Government's implementation
            performance, would be better suited to support the
            country's development needs and context.
